newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexican daily port, shipping update for April 4.
newsitem.headline: Mexican daily port, shipping update for April 4.

text.p: All Mexican ports were open on Friday, the Communications and Transport Ministry (SCT) said in its 1500 local/2100 GMT daily meteorological report.
A weak cold front moving south from the Texas coast threatened to provoke strong winds in the gulf over the weekend.
The ministry updated port conditions and shipping warnings for the Pacific Coast, Gulf of Mexico and Caribbean.
Some clouds and light isolated showers in Sonora and Sinaloa states. Maximum winds 10 to 15 knots (19 to 28 km/11 to 16 miles per hour) and waves three to six feet high.

Some light rains along coasts of Veracruz and Tamaulipas states. Winds in the northwest gulf from the southeast at 25 to 30 knots (47 to 57 km/27 to 33 miles per hour) and waves eight to 11 feet high, rolling south later in the day or early Saturday.
Remainder of gulf experiencing winds of 10 to 15 knots and waves four to eight feet high.
Hot and partly cloudy with moderate winds from 20 to 30 km per hour.
